understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named getInternodeSocketSendBufferSizeInBytes which returns the value of a variable conf.internode_socket_send_buffer_size_in_bytes.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to setting the socket buffer size for internode communication. It retrieves the value from a configuration variable conf.internode_socket_send_buffer_size_in_bytes.

config_description: Uncomment to set socket buffer size for internode communication Note that when setting this, the buffer size is limited by net.core.wmem_max and when not setting it it is defined by net.ipv4.tcp_wmem See also: /proc/sys/net/core/wmem_max /proc/sys/net/core/rmem_max /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_wmem /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_wmem and 'man tcp'
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code retrieves the socket send buffer size in bytes. It first checks if the value is not null, then returns the value. If the value is null, it retrieves the value from the DatabaseDescriptor class using the getInternodeSocketSendBufferSizeInBytes method.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever the socket send buffer size needs to be retrieved for internode communication. The frequency of triggering depends on the frequency of internode communication in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Setting the socket buffer size for internode communication can impact the performance of internode communication. It can affect the buffer size limit, which is determined by net.core.wmem_max when set, and net.ipv4.tcp_wmem when not set. The impact can be seen in the network throughput and latency of internode communication.
